content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Implement AS MANY new ideas as you can as PopeBot skills in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). For EACH skill: create the SKILL.md, write the implementation code, and write and run a test to prove it works. Do not stop at one skill â€” keep going until you run out of good ideas or time. After you have built and tested everything, use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a comprehensive progress report listing every skill you built, your test results for each, and code samples.

content.thinking:
This is a comprehensive task that requires me to:

1. Scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures
2. Implement as many new ideas as possible as PopeBot skills
3. For each skill: create SKILL.md, write implementation code, and write/run tests
4. Email a comprehensive progress report to winsorllc@yahoo.com

Let me start by exploring the three repositories to understand what's available. I'll need to clone or fetch information from these repos to see what skills and tools they contain.

Let me start by examining what's already in the current environment and then explore the external repositories.

First, let me check what skills are already available and what the current structure looks like.

content.text: I'll systematically scan the three repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement as many new PopeBot skills as possible. Let me start by exploring what's available.

---
name: llm-secrets
description: List available LLM-accessible credentials. Use when you need API keys, passwords, or other secrets that have been made available to you.
---

# List Available Secrets

```bash
/job/.pi/skills/llm-secrets/llm-secrets.js
```

Shows the names of available secret keys (not values). Output example:

```
Available secrets:
  - BROWSER_PASSWORD
  - SOME_API_KEY

To get a value: echo $KEY_NAME
```

## Get a Secret Value

```bash
echo $KEY_NAME
```

Replace `KEY_NAME` with one of the available secret names.

## When to Use

- When a skill or tool needs authentication credentials
- When logging into a website via browser tools
- When calling an external API that requires a key

content.thinking: Good, I can see the current skills. Now let me clone and explore the three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures. I'll start by cloning them into /job/tmp/ and examining their structure.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repo-scan && cd /job/tmp/repo-scan && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | tail -5

content.thinking: The clone is starting. Let me wait for it and clone the other repos in parallel.
